page.title: 20A walk up Haltwhistle Burn
page.content: The footpath follows the track of a railway line on which a small "tankie" steam engine used to pull loads of whinstone from Cawfields Quarry. In the past the narrow valley formed by the Haltwhistle Burn was the centre of local industry and reminders of this are all around. Stone walls show where a woollen mill once made good use of a ready supply of wool. Spoil heaps and a chimney mark the spot where fireclay goods were once made.A lime kiln can be seen where farmers used coal to burn limestone to spread on sour land to help the grass grow. Entrances to a drift mine can be seen, and the chimney and platforms for the winding gear. The energetic can count the 125 steps of the Catstairs while the rest of the party enjoy watching dippers feeding in the Burn.
